analyzed: nga yang grong gi zhing las dag la 'gro'o zhes smras nas /

analyzed: sdong du ma tshig pa ni 'dra /

analyzed: 'dre lta bur ni gyur cing /

analyzed: gso ras ni gyon /

original: mgo ni yegs /
analyzed: mgo ni yegs /

analyzed: gtun dang / gtun bu dang / glang chen dang / khri la sogs pa'i ched du gcig la gcig kha'i mdung thung gis ni 'debs pa mthong nas song ste /

analyzed: khyed su'i yin /

analyzed: bzang mo gang du 'gro bar 'dod /

analyzed: gal te de ltar na bdag ji sngar khyim nas thong zhig //
translated: “If that is so, then let me go as I was before.”

original: ci'i phyir / bzang mos 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir / bzang mos 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod sngar je bzhud na bud med ni 'bras chan tshos pa dang 'dra bar skye bo mang pos don du gnyer bar bgyi ba lags te /

analyzed: khyod bzhud na bdag kha cig gis don du gnyer bar gyur na mi rung ba de srid do //

analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u n+ya gro dha skyes kyis bsams pa /
translated: Then the young brahmin Nāḍa-born thought,

analyzed: bu mo 'di ni mkhas shing blo shin tu gtan la bab pa yin no snyam du bsams te / ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo @54a *//

analyzed: la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He thought this and said to the young brahmin Bhadra:

original: bzang mo tshur shog /
analyzed: bzang mo tshur shog /

analyzed: khyim nas lhan cig kho nar 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: Let’s go together from the house.”

analyzed: de dag khyim nas lhan cig kho nar dong ngo //

analyzed: de nas bram ze'i khye'u n+ya gro dha skyes dang tha gi tsam gyi bar du lhan cig kho nar dong nas /

original: ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the Licchavi girl Sumati,

analyzed: bzang mo song la spyod pa ji ltar 'dod pa la gnas par gyis shig /
translated: “Sumati, go and live as you wish.”

analyzed: de yang gcer bu pa dang / gcer bu pa'i slob ma du mas yongs su bskor to //

analyzed: de nas ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo gcer bu pa rdzogs byed ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /

analyzed: gcer bu pa rdzogs byed la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: btsun pa bdag khyod las rab tu 'byung bar 'tshal lo //

analyzed: des der rab tu phyung nas gcer bu ma rnams kyi nang du bzhag go /
translated: He allowed her to go forth and placed her among the naked ascetics.

original: de nas gcer pu pa de rnams kyis ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo gzugs bzang ba; blta na sdug pa mdzes pa /
analyzed: de nas gcer pu pa de rnams kyis ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo gzugs bzang ba; blta na sdug pa mdzes pa /
translated: Then those naked ascetics saw that the Licchavi girl Sumati had a beautiful form, was pleasing to the eye, and was lovely.

original: kha dog rgyas pa /
analyzed: kha dog rgyas pa /
translated: He saw that they were well-proportioned,

original: mchog dang ldan pa mthong nas gcig la gcig smras pa /
analyzed: mchog dang ldan pa mthong nas gcig la gcig smras pa /

analyzed: bdag cag rab tu byung ba gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyi phyir yin la /
translated: “Whatever we do when we go forth is for the sake of the five divine pleasures.

analyzed: ser skya'i bu mo bzang mo bzang mo 'di yang lha'i bud med 'dra na /

analyzed: re zhig lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams rnyed dam / mi rnyed gtol med kyi /

analyzed: je ser skya'i bu @54b mo bzang mo 'di la longs spyod par bya'o zhes smras nas /
translated: But for now, let’s enjoy the pleasures of Kapila’s daughter.”

analyzed: babs nas stan bshams pa la 'dug go /

translated: fish, turtles, frogs, sea monsters, and porpoises, and piled them up in heaps, like sesame seeds, rice, beans, jujubes, and peas.

original: gang dag gis rgya mo spyod pa chen po bcug pa de dag gis ni rgya mtsho chen po nas chu klung yid 'ong ldan du zhugs pa /
analyzed: gang dag gis rgya mo spyod pa chen po bcug pa de dag gis ni rgya mtsho chen po nas chu klung yid 'ong ldan du zhugs pa /
translated: Those who were put to work in the pearl beds entered the ocean and the river Ganges.

original: chu srin chen po nya'i rigs bong tshod chen po nyal ba zin nas de dag gis de drang bar brtsams so //
analyzed: chu srin chen po nya'i rigs bong tshod chen po nyal ba zin nas de dag gis de drang bar brtsams so //
translated: There they saw a huge sea monster, a type of fish, lying there asleep. They began to pull it out.

original: de dag gis drangs pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis drangs pa na /
translated: As they pulled it out,

original: de sad nas nya pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag dang / rgya mo spyod pa chen po khyer te rgyun phyogs su zhugs so //
analyzed: de sad nas nya pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag dang / rgya mo spyod pa chen po khyer te rgyun phyogs su zhugs so //
translated: When he awoke, he took with him the two hundred and fifty fishermen and the great-acting fisherwoman, and they went with the current.

original: nya pa de @79b dag gis nya pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po gzhan dag la /
analyzed: nya pa de @79b dag gis nya pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po gzhan dag la /
translated: Those fishermen said to the other two hundred and fifty fishermen,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: rgya mo spyod pa chen po dang bdag cag khyer gyi ra mda' log ces byas so //
analyzed: rgya mo spyod pa chen po dang bdag cag khyer gyi ra mda' log ces byas so //
translated: we are being carried away by the great-acting fisherwoman. Let’s go back!”

original: de dag gis thos nas /
analyzed: de dag gis thos nas /
translated: When they heard that,

original: nya pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po gzhan de dag kyang lhags te /
analyzed: nya pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po gzhan de dag kyang lhags te /
translated: the other two hundred and fifty fishermen came too,

original: de nyid la rub pa dang / de dag kyang khyer ro //
analyzed: de nyid la rub pa dang / de dag kyang khyer ro //
translated: and they all gathered there, and they were carried away as well.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu sa phyogs mthon por 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu sa phyogs mthon por 'dug ste /
translated: Then, after that, they sat on a high place,

original: bos pa dang / de nas phyug rdzi dang / ba lang rdzi la sogs pa 'ongs nas 'bad pa chen pos phyung ba dang / chu srin nya'i rigs ri bo brtsegs pa 'dra ba /
analyzed: bos pa dang / de nas phyug rdzi dang / ba lang rdzi la sogs pa 'ongs nas 'bad pa chen pos phyung ba dang / chu srin nya'i rigs ri bo brtsegs pa 'dra ba /
translated: and called out. Then the cowherds, the shepherds, and so on came, and with great effort they pulled out a makara, a kind of fish, that looked like a mountain peak,

original: mgo bo bco brgyad dang / mig sum cu rtsa drug yod pa phyung ngo //
analyzed: mgo bo bco brgyad dang / mig sum cu rtsa drug yod pa phyung ngo //
translated: with eighteen heads and thirty-six eyes.

original: ji tsam na skye bo'i tshogs chen po 'ongs te lhags pa dang / ston pa drug po ston pa ma yin par ston par khas 'che ba /
analyzed: ji tsam na skye bo'i tshogs chen po 'ongs te lhags pa dang / ston pa drug po ston pa ma yin par ston par khas 'che ba /
translated: and the six teachers, who were not teachers but claimed to be,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen par khas 'che ba /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen par khas 'che ba /
translated: who were not omniscient but claimed to be,

original: drug po gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: drug po gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: Who were the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were:🔽Purana Kasyapa,🔽Sanjaya Belatthiputta,🔽Ajita Kesakambala,

original: 'od srung rdzogs byed dang / kun tu rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu dag ste /
analyzed: 'od srung rdzogs byed dang / kun tu rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu dag ste /
translated: Kakuda Katyayana, and Nirgrantha Jnatiputra.

original: ston pa ma yin par ston par khas 'che ba drug po 'di dag kyang de'i tshe ltad mo la lhags so //
analyzed: ston pa ma yin par ston par khas 'che ba drug po 'di dag kyang de'i tshe ltad mo la lhags so //
translated: These six, who were not teachers but claimed to be, also came to see the spectacle.

original: de'i bar du yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la ni mi mkhyen pa dang / ma gzigs pa dang / ma rig pa dang / rnam par mi mkhyen pa ci yang mi mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos nyid kyis 'tsho zhing gzhes la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de'i bar du yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la ni mi mkhyen pa dang / ma gzigs pa dang / ma rig pa dang / rnam par mi mkhyen pa ci yang mi mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos nyid kyis 'tsho zhing gzhes la bzhugs pa /
translated: In the meantime, the Blessed Buddha, the Blessed One, has nothing that is not known, not seen, not discerned, not cognized. The Blessed Buddha, the Blessed One, lives by the nature of phenomena,

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: he has great compassion,

original: gzhan la phan par bzhugs pa /
analyzed: gzhan la phan par bzhugs pa /
translated: he lives to benefit others,

original: @80a *// dge ba'i spyod pa la mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: @80a *// dge ba'i spyod pa la mi g-yo ba /
translated: he is unwavering in virtuous conduct,

original: pha rol gnon pa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa /
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa /
translated: he has firm diligence in subduing others,

original: nyag gcig dpa' ba /
analyzed: nyag gcig dpa' ba /
translated: he is the sole hero,

original: bsrung ba gcig pu pa /
analyzed: bsrung ba gcig pu pa /
translated: he is the sole protector,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: he is non-dual,

original: gnyis su mi gsung ba //
analyzed: gnyis su mi gsung ba //
translated: he does not speak dualistically,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la gnas pa /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la gnas pa /
translated: he abides in śamatha and vipaśyanā,

original: rig pa gsum gsal bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: rig pa gsum gsal bar mdzad pa /
translated: he illuminates the three knowledges,

original: bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa /
translated: he is well-trained in the three trainings,

original: gdul ba'i gzhi gsum la mkhas pa /
analyzed: gdul ba'i gzhi gsum la mkhas pa /
translated: he is skilled in the three bases of discipline,

original: lam gsum spangs pa //
analyzed: lam gsum spangs pa //
translated: he has abandoned the three paths,

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: he is free from desire in the three realms,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa med pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa med pa /
translated: he is fearless with the four fearlessnesses,

original: chu bo bzhi las rgal ba /
analyzed: chu bo bzhi las rgal ba /
translated: They have crossed the four rivers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis spyod pa'i gzhi la legs par gnas pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis spyod pa'i gzhi la legs par gnas pa /
translated: They are well established in the bases of training through the four legs of miraculous ability.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas yongs su sbyong ba mdzad pa /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas yongs su sbyong ba mdzad pa /
translated: They have trained for a long time in the four means of gathering.

original: yan lag lnga spangs pa /
analyzed: yan lag lnga spangs pa /
translated: They have abandoned the five branches.

original: 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: They have perfectly transcended the five realms.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: They have perfected the six perfections.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa /
translated: They possess the six branches.

original: rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug gis gnas pa /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug gis gnas pa /

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa /

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ston pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ston pa /

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa /
translated: They are skilled in the nine serial absorptions.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
translated: They possess the power of the ten powers.

original: phyogs bcur snyan pas yang dag par rgyas pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur snyan pas yang dag par rgyas pa /
translated: They are perfectly renowned in the ten directions.🔽They are superior to those who rule over hundreds of thousands.

original: brgya phrag bcur dbang sgyur ba las khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyis chos nyid ni nyin lan gsum /
analyzed: brgya phrag bcur dbang sgyur ba las khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyis chos nyid ni nyin lan gsum /
translated: The nature of phenomena is that they are seen three times a day

original: mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs nas /
analyzed: mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs nas /
translated: Three times a day, the Buddha would look out over the world with his buddha eye.

original: su ni nyams par gyur /
analyzed: su ni nyams par gyur /
translated: “Who is declining?🔽Who is flourishing?🔽Who is in pain?

original: su ni 'phel bar @80b 'gyur; su ni gnod par gyur /
analyzed: su ni 'phel bar @80b 'gyur; su ni gnod par gyur /
translated: Who is in distress?

original: su ni nyam nga bar gyur /🔽su ni gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang mi bde bar gyur /
analyzed: su ni nyam nga bar gyur / su ni gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang mi bde bar gyur /

analyzed: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa ni bskyed par bya / gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams ni yongs su smin par bya /
translated: Who has not yet planted the roots of virtue? I will help them to plant them.🔽Who has planted the roots of virtue? I will help them to ripen them.

original: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams ni thar bar bya /
analyzed: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams ni thar bar bya /
translated: Who has ripened the roots of virtue? I will help them to be liberated.

original: gang zhig 'phags pa rnams kyi nor gyi dbyig dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig 'phags pa rnams kyi nor gyi dbyig dang bral ba ni /
translated: Who is without the wealth of the noble ones?

original: 'phags pa'i nor gyi dbang phyug la gzhag par bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor gyi dbang phyug la gzhag par bya /
translated: I will establish them in the wealth of the noble ones.

original: gang ni mi'i 'bras bu la gnas /
analyzed: gang ni mi'i 'bras bu la gnas /
translated: Who is living the human life?

original: gang ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dul /
analyzed: gang ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dul /
translated: Who is to be guided by the Buddha?

original: gang ni nyan thos kyis 'dul /
analyzed: gang ni nyan thos kyis 'dul /
translated: Who is to be guided by the hearers?

original: gang ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyis 'dul /
analyzed: gang ni sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyis 'dul /

original: gang ni 'dod chags la spyod /
analyzed: gang ni 'dod chags la spyod /

original: gang ni zhe sdang la spyod /
analyzed: gang ni zhe sdang la spyod /

original: gang ni gti mug la spyod /
analyzed: gang ni gti mug la spyod /

analyzed: gang ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod / gang ni nyes pa rnams kyis gnod par gyur /
translated: Who engages in desire, anger, and delusion?🔽Who is harmed by faults?

original: gang ni ngan song la gzhol /🔽gang ni ngan song la 'bab /
analyzed: gang ni ngan song la gzhol / gang ni ngan song la 'bab /
translated: Who is inclined toward the lower realms?🔽Who has fallen into the lower realms?

original: gang ni ngan song la bab /
analyzed: gang ni ngan song la bab /
translated: Who is in the lower realms?

original: ngas gang ni ngan song las bslang ste /
analyzed: ngas gang ni ngan song las bslang ste /
translated: Whom shall I lift out of the lower realms

original: mtho ris dang / thar pa dang / 'bras bu la rab tu gzhag par bya /
analyzed: mtho ris dang / thar pa dang / 'bras bu la rab tu gzhag par bya /
translated: and establish in the fruits of the higher realms and liberation?

original: nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba gang gi lag nas ni drang bar bya /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa'i 'dam du bying ba gang gi lag nas ni drang bar bya /
translated: From whose hand shall I take away the mud of bad actions?

analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas 'byung bas brgyan pa'i 'jig rten na 'bras bu dang bcas par bya zhes mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa 'jug go /
translated: Whom shall I make fruitful in a world adorned by the appearance of a buddha?”

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: He also said:

original: rgya mtsho chu srin rnams kyi gnas //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chu srin rnams kyi gnas //
translated: “The ocean, the abode of sea monsters,

original: dus las 'da' bar 'gyur srid kyi //
analyzed: dus las 'da' bar 'gyur srid kyi //
translated: may pass beyond its boundaries,

original: gdul bya ba la byams sangs rgyas ni //
analyzed: gdul bya ba la byams sangs rgyas ni //
translated: but the Buddha, who is loving toward those to be trained,

original: dus las 'da' bar mi mdzad do //
analyzed: dus las 'da' bar mi mdzad do //

original: ji ltar ma ni bu sdug gcig pu la //
analyzed: ji ltar ma ni bu sdug gcig pu la //
translated: Just as a mother, with a single thought,

original: rtog cing de srog srung ba byed pa @81a *//
analyzed: rtog cing de srog srung ba byed pa @81a *//

analyzed: rtog par mdzad cing de srog srung bar mdzad //

original: kun mkhyen rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje yi //
analyzed: kun mkhyen rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje yi //
translated: The compassion of the Omniscient One, which is present in the mindstream,

analyzed: ba bzhon gdul ba'i be'u tshol mi skye ste //
translated: does not arise for those who are not vessels to be trained.

analyzed: srid dang ngan 'gros nyams la byams pa ni //

original: be'u sdug stor la byams pa'i ba bzhon bzhin //
analyzed: be'u sdug stor la byams pa'i ba bzhon bzhin //
translated: is like the love of a cow for her beloved calf that has been lost.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes gzigs pa sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i spyan /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān’s unobstructed eye of wisdom
